text.sanskrit: त्वां ह्यग्ने सदमित्समन्यवो देवासो देवमरतिं न्येरिर इति क्रत्वा न्येरिरे ।अमर्त्यं यजत मर्त्येष्वा देवमादेवं जनत प्रचेतसं विश्वमादेवं जनत प्रचेतसं ॥
text.iast: tvām  hí  agne  sadam  ít  sa-manyavaḥ  devāsaḥ  devam  aratím  ni-erire  íti  kratvā  ni-erire amartyam  yajata  martyeṣu  ā  devam  ā-devam  janata  pra-cetasam  víśvam  ā-devam  janata  pra-cetasam ||

translations.text: Since the emulous gods ever excite you,Agni, who are a deity swift of motion, (to contest), therefore do (your worshippers) urge you by their devotions (to bring the deities to their sacrifices); adorable Agni, they (the deities), have genitive rated you, immortal, divine, all-wise, as the present divinity among men; they have genitive rated you as the all-present and all-wise deity.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: स भ्रातरं वरुणमग्न आ ववृत्स्व देवाँ अच्छा सुमती यज्ञवनसं ज्येष्ठं यज्ञवनसं ।ऋतावानमादित्यं चर्षणीधृतं राजानं चर्षणीधृतं ॥
text.iast: saḥ  bhrātaram  varuṇam  agne  ā  vavṛtsva  devān  accha  su-matī  yajña-vanasam  jyeṣṭham  yajña-vanasam ṛta-vānam  ādityam  carṣaṇi-dhṛtam  rājānam  carṣaṇi-dhṛtam ||

translations.text: Bring to the presence of the worshippers,Agni, your brotherVaruṇa, as a participator fo the sacrifice, with a willing mind, the elder participator of the sacrifice; the ruler of the water, theĀditya, the supporter of men the sovereign venerated by mankind.

text.sanskrit: सखे सखायमभ्या ववृत्स्वाशुं न चक्रं रथ्येव रंह्यास्मभ्यं दस्म रंह्या ।अग्ने मृळीकं वरुणे सचा विदो मरुत्सु विश्वभानुषु ।तोकाय तुजे शुशुचान शं कृध्यस्मभ्यं दस्म शं कृधि ॥
text.iast: sakhe  sakhāyam  abhí  ā  vavṛtsva  āśum  na  cakram  rathyā-iva  raṃhyā  asmabhyam  dasma  raṃhyā agne  mṛḷīkam  varuṇe  sacā  vidaḥ  marut-su  viśva-bhānuṣu tokāya  tuje  śuśucāna  śam  kṛdhi  asmabhyam  dasma  śam  kṛdhi ||

translations.text: Friendly and beautiful (Agni), bring your friend (Varruṇa) to our presence, as two strong horses convey the swift chariot along the road to its goal; you receive, Agni, the gratifying (oblation) together withVaruṇa, and with the all-illuminigMaruts; grant, brilliant Agni, happiness to our sons and grandsons; grant, beautiful Agni, happiness to ourselves.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वं नो अग्ने वरुणस्य विद्वांदेवस्य हेळोऽव यासिसीष्ठाः ।यजिष्ठो वह्नितमः शोशुचानो विश्वा द्वेषांसि प्र मुमुग्ध्यस्मत् ॥
text.iast: tvam  naḥ  agne  varuṇasya  vidvān  devasya  heḷaḥ  ava  yāsisīṣṭhāḥ yajiṣṭhaḥ  vahni-tamaḥ  śośucānaḥ  víśvā  dveṣāṃsi  pra  mumugdhi  asmat ||

translations.text: May youAgni, who are wise, avert from us the wrath of the divineVaruṇa; do you, who are the most frequent sacrificer, the most diligent bearer (of oblations), the most resplendent liberate us from all animosities.

text.sanskrit: स त्वं नो अग्नेऽवमो भवोती नेदिष्ठो अस्या उषसो व्युष्टौ ।अव यक्ष्व नो वरुणं रराणो वीहि मृळीकं सुहवो न एधि ॥
text.iast: saḥ  tvam  naḥ  agne  avamaḥ  bhava  ūtī  nediṣṭhaḥ  asyāḥ  uṣasaḥ  ví-uṣṭau ava  yakṣva  naḥ  varuṇam  rarāṇaḥ  vīhí  mṛḷīkam  su-havaḥ  naḥ  edhi ||

translations.text: Do youAgniour preserver bemost nigh to us with your protection at the breaking of this dawn; deprecateVaruṇafor us and propitiated (by our praise) feed upon the grateful (oblation), and be to us of auspicious invocation.

text.sanskrit: अस्य श्रेष्ठा सुभगस्य संदृग्देवस्य चित्रतमा मर्त्येषु ।शुचि घृतं न तप्तमघ्न्यायाः स्पार्हा देवस्य मंहनेव धेनोः ॥
text.iast: asya  śreṣṭhā  su-bhagasya  sam-dṛk  devasya  citra-tamā  martyeṣu śuci  ghṛtam  na  taptam  aghnyāyāḥ  spārhā  devasya  maṃhanā-iva  dhenoḥ ||

translations.text: The glance of this auspicious deity, directed towards men, is most excellent, most wonderful, acceptable (to all) as the pure warm butter (from the milk) of the cow (is acceptable) to the deity; as the gift of a cow (is to a man).

text.sanskrit: त्रिरस्य ता परमा संति सत्या स्पार्हा देवस्य जनिमान्यग्नेः ।अनंते अंतः परिवीत आगाच्छुचिः शुक्रो अर्यो रोरुचानः ॥

translations.text: These are the supreme, true, and desirable births of this divineAgni, invested (with radiance) in the unbounded (firmament); pure, bright, radiant lord (of all), may he come (to our) sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: स दूतो विश्वेदभि वष्टि सद्मा होता हिरण्यरथो रंसुजिह्वः ।रोहिदश्वो वपुष्यो विभावा सदा रण्वः पितुमतीव संसत् ॥
text.iast: saḥ  dūtaḥ  víśvā  ít  abhí  vaṣṭi  sadma  hotā  híraṇya-rathaḥ  ram-sujihvaḥ rohít-aśvaḥ  vapuṣyaḥ  vibhā-vā  sadā  raṇvaḥ  pitumatī-iva  sam-sat ||

translations.text: The messenger, the invoker (of the gods), riding in a golden chariot with a tongue of flame, he frequents all the chambers (of sacrifice); drawn by red horses embodied resplendent, always agreeable, as a delling well supplied with food.

text.sanskrit: स चेतयन्मनुषो यज्ञबंधुः प्र तं मह्या रशनया नयंति ।स क्षेत्यस्य दुर्यासु साधंदेवो मर्तस्य सधनित्वमाप ॥
text.iast: saḥ  cetayat  manuṣaḥ  yajña-bandhuḥ  pra  tam  mahyā  raśanayā  nayanti saḥ  kṣeti  asya  duryāsu  sādhan  devaḥ  martasya  sadhani-tvam  āpa ||

translations.text: Associated with sacrifice, and knowing those men (who are engaged in good works), they lead him with the strong cord (of praise); he, the divineAgni, fulfilling (all desires), abides in the dwelling of this mortal, and obtains fellowhip in his wealth.

text.sanskrit: स तू नो अग्निर्नयतु प्रजानन्नच्छा रत्नं देवभक्तं यदस्य ।धिया यद्विश्वे अमृता अकृण्वंद्यौष्पिता जनिता सत्यमुक्षन् ॥

translations.text: May that wiseAgniconduct us to that wealth which is desired by the devout; he whom all the immortals have created for (the performance of) sacred oblations, the most rresplendent, liberate us from all animosities.

text.sanskrit: स जायत प्रथमः पस्त्यासु महो बुध्ने रजसो अस्य योनौ ।अपादशीर्षा गुहमानो अंतायोयुवानो वृषभस्य नीळे ॥
text.iast: saḥ  jāyata  prathamaḥ  pastyāsu  mahaḥ  budhne  rajasaḥ  asya  yonau apāt  aśīrṣā  guhamānaḥ  antā  ā-yoyuvānaḥ  vṛṣabhasya  nīḷe ||

translations.text: He is first engendered in the habitation (of the sacrificers); then upon his station, (the altar), the base of the vast firmament; without feet, without head, concealing his extremities, combining with smoke in the nest of the rain-cloud.

text.sanskrit: प्र शर्ध आर्त प्रथमं विपन्यँ ऋतस्य योना वृषभस्य नीळे ।स्पार्हो युवा वपुष्यो विभावा सप्त प्रियासोऽजनयंत वृष्णे ॥
text.iast: pra  śardhaḥ  ārta  prathamam  vipanyā  ṛtasya  yonā  vṛṣabhasya  nīḷe spārhaḥ  yuvā  vapuṣyaḥ  vibhā-vā  sapta  priyāsaḥ  ajanayanta  vṛṣṇe ||

translations.text: Radiance has first proceeded to you, (Agni), who are glorified by praise, in the womb of the water, in the nest of the rain-cloud; the seven attached (priests) have engendered (praise) to the showerer (of benefits), who desirable, ever young, embodied, and resplendent.

text.sanskrit: अस्माकमत्र पितरो मनुष्या अभि प्र सेदुर्ऋतमाशुषाणाः ।अश्मव्रजाः सुदुघा वव्रे अंतरुदुस्रा आजन्नुषसो हुवानाः ॥
text.iast: asmākam  atra  pitaraḥ  manuṣyāḥ  abhí  pra  seduḥ  ṛtam  āśuṣāṇāḥ aśma-vrajāḥ  su-dughāḥ  vavre  antaḥ  ut  usrāḥ  ājan  uṣasaḥ  huvānāḥ ||

translations.text: In this world, our mortal forefathers departed after instrumental tuting the sacred rite, when, calling upon the dawn, they extricated the milk-yielding kine, concealed among the rocks in the darkness (of the cave).

text.sanskrit: ते मर्मृजत ददृवांसो अद्रिं तदेषामन्ये अभितो वि वोचन् ।पश्वयंत्रासो अभि कारमर्चन्विदंत ज्योतिश्चकृपंत धीभिः ॥

translations.text: Rending the rocks, they worshipped (Agni), and other (sages) taught everywhere their (acts); unprovided with the means of (extricating) the cattle, they glorified the author of success, whence they found the light, and were thus enabled (to worship him) with holy ceremonies.

text.sanskrit: ते गव्यता मनसा दृध्रमुब्धं गा येमानं परि षंतमद्रिं ।दृळ्हं नरो वचसा दैव्येन व्रजं गोमंतमुशिजो वि वव्रुः ॥

text.sanskrit: यो मर्त्येष्वमृत ऋतावा देवो देवेष्वरतिर्निधायि ।होता यजिष्ठो मह्ना शुचध्यै हव्यैरग्निर्मनुष ईरयध्यै ॥

translations.text: He who has beenplaced immortal among the mortals, the observer of truth, a deity triumphant among gods, the invoker of the gods, the most diligent sacrificer,Agni; he has been plural ced (upon the altar) to lighten (the ceremony) by his (lustre), and for the elevation of the worshipper, through oblations (in heaven).

text.sanskrit: इह त्वं सूनो सहसो नो अद्य जातो जाताँ उभयाँ अंतरग्ने ।दूत ईयसे युयुजान ऋष्व ऋजुमुष्कान्वृषणः शुक्रांश्च ॥

translations.text: Agni, son of strength, genitive rated today at this our rite, as intermediate between both (gods and men) you proceed, the invoker (of the gods), harnessing, graceful Agni, your robust, vigorous, and resplendent steeds.

translations.text: I celebrate the ruddy, food-bestowing, water- shedding, and swifter-than-thought-going, steeds of him who is the truth; harnessing the brilliant pair (to your chariot), you pass between the deities of whom you are, and human worshippers.

translations.text: May the sacrifice,Agni, be productive of cows, of sheep, of horses, and celebrated by your worshipper, aided by the priests, be ever uninterrupted; may it, mighty Agni, be productive of food and progeny, long continued, affluent, wide based, and held in full assembly.

translations.text: You are the munificent recompenser of that man who, sweating (with toil), brings you fuel, and for your service causes his head to ache; protect him,Agnifrom every one that seeks to do him evil.

text.sanskrit: अयं योनिश्चकृमा यं वयं ते जायेव पत्य उशती सुवासाः ।अर्वाचीनः परिवीतो नि षीदेमा उ ते स्वपाक प्रतीचीः ॥
text.iast: ayam  yoniḥ  cakṛma  yam  vayam  te  jāyā-iva  patye  uśatī  su-vāsāḥ arvācīnaḥ  pari-vītaḥ  ní  sīda  imāḥ  ūṃ íti  te  su-apāka  pratīcīḥ ||

translations.text: This is the altar which we have decorated for you, as a wife attached to her husband puts on elegant garments (to gratify him); maturer of good works, sit down in our presence invested (with radiance), while your flames incline towards you.

text.sanskrit: आशृण्वते अदृपिताय मन्म नृचक्षसे सुमृळीकाय वेधः ।देवाय शस्तिममृताय शंस ग्रावेव सोता मधुषुद्यमीळे ॥
text.iast: āśṛṇvate  adṛpitāya  manma  nṛ-cakṣase  su-mṛḷīkāya  vedhaḥ devāya  śastím  amṛtāya  śaṃsa  grāvā-iva  sotā  madhu-sut  yam  īḷe ||

translations.text: Repeat, oḥ priest, the praise, the prayer, to the attentive, the affableAgni, the beholder of man, the giver of felicity, the divine, the immortal; to him whom the effuser of the libation, like the (bruising) stone, adores aloud.

text.sanskrit: त्वं चिन्नः शम्या अग्ने अस्या ऋतस्य बोध्यृतचित्स्वाधीः ।कदा त उक्था सधमाद्यानि कदा भवंति सख्या गृहे ते ॥
text.iast: tvam  cit  naḥ  śamyai  agne  asyāḥ  ṛtasya  bodhi  ṛta-cit  su-ādhīḥ kadā  te  ukthā  sadha-mādyāni  kadā  bhavanti  sakhyā  gṛhe  te ||

translations.text: YouAgni, preside over this our rite; do you who are cognizant of truth, and the author of good works, recognize this our adoration, whenever these exhilarating prayers (are addressed) to you whenever friendly relations with you are (established) in our dwelling.

text.sanskrit: कथा ह तद्वरुणाय त्वमग्ने कथा दिवे गर्हसे कन्न आगः ।कथा मित्राय मीळ्हुषे पृथिव्यै ब्रवः कदर्यम्णे कद्भगाय ॥
text.iast: kathā  ha  tat  varuṇāya  tvam  agne  kathā  dive  garhase  kat  naḥ  āgaḥ kathā  mitrāya  mīḷhuṣe  pṛthivyai  bravaḥ  kat  aryamṇe  kat  bhagāya ||

translations.text: Why,Agni, do you reproach us (for our sin) toVaruṇa, why to the heaven? what is our offence? why repeat it to the bountifulMitra, to earth, toAryaman, or toBhaga?

text.sanskrit: कद्धिष्ण्यासु वृधसानो अग्ने कद्वाताय प्रतवसे शुभंये ।परिज्मने नासत्याय क्षे ब्रवः कदग्ने रुद्राय नृघ्ने ॥
text.iast: kat  dhíṣṇyāsu  vṛdhasānaḥ  agne  kat  vātāya  pra-tavase  śubham-ye pari-jmane  nāsatyāya  kṣe  bravaḥ  kat  agne  rudrāya  nṛ-ghne ||

translations.text: Why repeat it when exalted in holy ceremonies? why tell it to the mighty, benevolent, circumambient, truthful wind? why,Agni, to earth, why to man-destroyingRudra?

text.sanskrit: कथा महे पुष्टिंभराय पूष्णे कद्रुद्राय सुमखाय हविर्दे ।कद्विष्णव उरुगायाय रेतो ब्रवः कदग्ने शरवे बृहत्यै ॥
text.iast: kathā  mahe  puṣṭim-bharāya  pūṣṇe  kat  rudrāya  su-makhāya  haviḥ-de kat  víṣṇave  uru-gāyāya  retaḥ  bravaḥ  kat  agne  śarave  bṛhatyai ||

translations.text: Why to the great and nutriment-conveyingPūṣan? why toRudra, the object of worship, the giver of the oblation (to the gods)? why to the many-hymnedViṣṇu? why tell our sin to the extensive year?

text.sanskrit: कथा शर्धाय मरुतामृताय कथा सूरे बृहते पृच्छ्यमानः ।प्रति ब्रवोऽदितये तुराय साधा दिवो जातवेदश्चिकित्वान् ॥

translations.text: Why tell it to the veracious company of theMaruts? why, even when asked, to the mighty sun? why repeat it toAditi, or to the swift wind? fulfil, all-knowingJātavedas, (the worship) of heaven.

text.sanskrit: ऋतेन ऋतं नियतमीळ आ गोरामा सचा मधुमत्पक्वमग्ने ।कृष्णा सती रुशता धासिनैषा जामर्येण पयसा पीपाय ॥
text.iast: ṛtena  ṛtam  ní-yatam  īḷe  ā  goḥ  āmā  sacā  madhu-mat  pakvam  agne kṛṣṇā  satī  ruśatā  dhāsínā  eṣā  jāmaryeṇa  payasā  pīpāya ||

translations.text: I solicit,Agni, the milk of the cow, essential for the sacrifice; yet immature, (she possesses) the sweet and ripe (fluid); black though she be, yet with her white nutritious milk she maintains mankind in existence.

text.sanskrit: ऋतेन हि ष्मा वृषभश्चिदक्तः पुमाँ अग्निः पयसा पृष्ठ्येन ।अस्पंदमानो अचरद्वयोधा वृषा शुक्रं दुदुहे पृश्निरूधः ॥
text.iast: ṛtena  hí  sma  vṛṣabhaḥ  cit  aktaḥ  pumān  agníḥ  payasā  pṛṣṭhyena aspandamānaḥ  acarat  vayaḥ-dhāḥ  vṛṣā  śukram  duduhe  pṛśniḥ  ūdhaḥ ||

translations.text: ThemaleAgni, the showerer (of benefits), has been sprinkled by the genitive ine sustaining milk; the giver of food proceeds unswerving (from his course), and the sun, the shedder of rain, has milked the white (fluid) of the udder (of the firmament).

text.sanskrit: ऋतेनाद्रिं व्यसन्भिदंतः समंगिरसो नवंत गोभिः ।शुनं नरः परि षदन्नुषासमाविः स्वरभवज्जाते अग्नौ ॥
text.iast: ṛtena  adrim  ví  asan  bhidantaḥ  sam  aṅgirasaḥ  navanta  gobhiḥ śunam  naraḥ  pari  sadan  uṣasam  āvíḥ  svaḥ  abhavat  jāte  agnau ||

translations.text: By the sacrifice, theAṅgirasas, rending the mountain asunder, have thrown it open, and returned with the cows; the leaders (of holy rites) have arrived happily at the dawn, and the sun was manifest asAgniwas engendered.

text.sanskrit: ऋतेन देवीरमृता अमृक्ता अर्णोभिरापो मधुमद्भिरग्ने ।वाजी न सर्गेषु प्रस्तुभानः प्र सदमित्स्रवितवे दधन्युः ॥
text.iast: ṛtena  devīḥ  amṛtāḥ  amṛktāḥ  arṇaḥ-bhiḥ  āpaḥ  madhumat-bhiḥ  agne vājī  na  sargeṣu  pra-stubhānaḥ  pra  sadam  ít  sravitave  dadhanyuḥ ||

translations.text: By sacrifice,Agni, the divine rivers, immortal, unobstructed, continue perpetually to flow with sweet waters, like a horse that is being urged in his speed.

text.sanskrit: मा कस्य यक्षं सदमिद्धुरो गा मा वेशस्य प्रमिनतो मापेः ।मा भ्रातुरग्ने अनृजोर्ऋणं वेर्मा सख्युर्दक्षं रिपोर्भुजेम ॥
text.iast: mā  kasya  yakṣam  sadam  ít  huraḥ  gāḥ  mā  veśasya  pra-minataḥ  mā  āpeḥ mā  bhrātuḥ  agne  anṛjoḥ  ṛṇam  veḥ  mā  sakhyuḥ  dakṣam  ripoḥ  bhujema ||

translations.text: Go not ever,Agni, to the sacrifice of any one who injures us; nor to that of a malevolent neighbour, nor to that of an (unnatural) relation; accept not the due (oblation) from an insincere brother; let us not derive enjoyment from the enemy of a friend.

text.sanskrit: रक्षा णो अग्ने तव रक्षणेभी रारक्षाणः सुमख प्रीणानः ।प्रति ष्फुर वि रुज वीड्वंहो जहि रक्षो महि चिद्वावृधानं ॥
text.iast: rakṣa  naḥ  agne  tava  rakṣaṇebhiḥ  rarakṣāṇaḥ  su-makha  prīṇānaḥ prati  sphura  ví  ruja  vīḷu  aṃhaḥ  jahí  rakṣaḥ  mahi  cit  vavṛdhānam ||

translations.text: Agni, worthily worshipped, counservator, conciliated (by our offerings), protect us with your protections; enlighten us; entirely extirpate our sin; overcome the great and exultingrākṣasas.

text.iast: ebhíḥ  bhava  su-manāḥ  agne  arkaiḥ  imān  spṛśa  manma-bhiḥ  śūra  vājān uta  brahmāṇi  aṅgiraḥ  juṣasva  sam  te  śastíḥ  deva-vātā  jareta ||

text.sanskrit: कृणुष्व पाजः प्रसितिं न पृथ्वीं याहि राजेवामवाँ इभेन ।तृष्वीमनु प्रसितिं द्रूणानोऽस्तासि विध्य रक्षसस्तपिष्ठैः ॥
text.iast: kṛṇuṣva  pājaḥ  pra-sitim  na  pṛthvīm  yāhí  rājā-iva  ama-vān  íbhena tṛṣvīm  anu  pra-sitim  drūṇānaḥ  astā  asi  vídhya  rakṣasaḥ  tapiṣṭhaiḥ ||

translations.text: Put forth your strength,Agni, as a fowler spreads a capacious snare; proceed like a king attended by his followers on his elephant; you are the scatterer (of your foes); following the swift-moving host consume therākṣasaswith your fiercest flames.

text.sanskrit: प्रति स्पशो वि सृज तूर्णितमो भवा पायुर्विशो अस्या अदब्धः ।यो नो दूरे अघशंसो यो अंत्यग्ने माकिष्टे व्यथिरा दधर्षीत् ॥

text.sanskrit: सेदग्ने अस्तु सुभगः सुदानुर्यस्त्वा नित्येन हविषा य उक्थैः ।पिप्रीषति स्व आयुषि दुरोणे विश्वेदस्मै सुदिना सासदिष्टिः ॥

translations.text: May the liberal man ever be prosperous who propitiate you with constant oblations and praises; may all the days in his arduous life be prosperous, and may this (his) sacrifice be (productive of reward).

text.sanskrit: अर्चामि ते सुमतिं घोष्यर्वाक्सं ते वावाता जरतामियं गीः ।स्वश्वास्त्वा सुरथा मर्जयेमास्मे क्षत्राणि धारयेरनु द्यून् ॥

translations.text: I reverence your good favour,Agni; may this reiterated and resounding hymn convey due praise to your presence; may we be possessed of good horses and good cars, that we may pay you homage; and do you daily bestow upon us riches.

text.sanskrit: इह त्वा भूर्या चरेदुप त्मंदोषावस्तर्दीदिवांसमनु द्यून् ।क्रीळंतस्त्वा सुमनसः सपेमाभि द्युम्ना तस्थिवांसो जनानां ॥

translations.text: May every one of his own accord diligently worship you, shining in the (hall) morning and evening, every day; thus, sporting in our dwellings, (enjoying) the wealth (of hostile) man, may we with happy hearts worship you.

text.sanskrit: यस्त्वा स्वश्वः सुहिरण्यो अग्न उपयाति वसुमता रथेन ।तस्य त्राता भवसि तस्य सखा यस्त आतिथ्यमानुषग्जुजोषत् ॥

translations.text: YouAgni, are the protector of him who, possessed of good horses and a golden car, approaches you with a chariot laden with wealth; you are the friend of him who gratifies you be the due performance of hospitality to you.

text.sanskrit: महो रुजामि बंधुता वचोभिस्तन्मा पितुर्गोतमादन्वियाय ।त्वं नो अस्य वचसश्चिकिद्धि होतर्यविष्ठ सुक्रतो दमूनाः ॥

translations.text: Invoker (of the gods), young (of the deities) possessed of excellent wisdom, through the alliance (with you produced) by holy texts, which came to me from my fatherGotama, I demolish the powerful (demons); do you who are the humbler (of foes), be cognizant of our praises.

text.sanskrit: अस्वप्नजस्तरणयः सुशेवा अतंद्रासोऽवृका अश्रमिष्ठाः ।ते पायवः सध्र्यंचो निषद्याग्ने तव नः पांत्वमूर ॥

text.sanskrit: ये पायवो मामतेयं ते अग्ने पश्यंतो अंधं दुरितादरक्षन् ।ररक्ष तान्त्सुकृतो विश्ववेदा दिप्संत इद्रिपवो नाह देभुः ॥
text.iast: ye  pāyavaḥ  māmateyam  te  agne  paśyantaḥ  andham  duḥ-itāt  arakṣan rarakṣa  tān  su-kṛtaḥ  viśva-vedāḥ  dípsantaḥ  ít  ripavaḥ  na  aha  debhuḥ ||

translations.text: Those your protecting (rays),Agni, which, beholding (what had chanced), preserved the blind son ofMamatāfrom misfortune; he, knowing all things, cherished those benevolent (rays), and his enemies, intending to destroy him, wrought him no harm.

text.sanskrit: त्वया वयं सधन्यस्त्वोतास्तव प्रणीत्यश्याम वाजान् ।उभा शंसा सूदय सत्यतातेऽनुष्ठुया कृणुह्यह्रयाण ॥
text.iast: tvayā  vayam  sa-dhanyaḥ  tvā-ūtāḥ  tava  pra-nītī  aśyāma  vājān ubhā  śaṃsā  sūdaya  satya-tāte  anuṣṭhuyā  kṛṇuhi  ahrayāṇa ||

translations.text: Agni, who are freed from shame, by you we are made opulent; by you we are protected; may we, through your guidance, attain abundant food; cherisher of truth, destroy both (sorts of calumniators), those who are nigh, those who are far off, and in due course fulfil (our desires).

translations.text: Like women who have no brethren, going (about from their own to their father's house), women adverse to their lords going astray, so the wicked, false (in thought), false (in speech), they give birth to this deep abyss (of hell).

text.sanskrit: का मर्यादा वयुना कद्ध वाममच्छा गमेम रघवो न वाजं ।कदा नो देवीरमृतस्य पत्नीः सूरो वर्णेन ततनन्नुषासः ॥
text.iast: kā  maryādā  vayunā  kat  ha  vāmam  accha  gamema  raghavaḥ  na  vājam kadā  naḥ  devīḥ  amṛtasya  patnīḥ  sūraḥ  varṇena  tatanan  uṣasaḥ ||

translations.text: Wha tis the limit, what are the objects, which is the desirable (end) to which we rush like swift (chargers) to the battle? when for us will the divine dawns, the brides of the immortal (sun), overspread (the world) with light.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अनिरेण वचसा फल्ग्वेन प्रतीत्येन कृधुनातृपासः ।अधा ते अग्ने किमिहा वदंत्यनायुधास आसता सचंतां ॥

translations.text: (Men are) not satisfied by unproductive, frivolous, inconclusive, scanty speech; then what,Agni, do they here say to you? devoid of the implements (of worship), let them suffer from distress.

text.sanskrit: अस्य श्रिये समिधानस्य वृष्णो वसोरनीकं दम आ रुरोच ।रुशद्वसानः सुदृशीकरूपः क्षितिर्न राया पुरुवारो अद्यौत् ॥

translations.text: For the prosperity of this (instrumental tutor of the rite), the host (of the flames) of the kindled (Agni), the showerer (of benefits), the giver of dwellings, has blazed in the hall (of sacrifice); clothed in radiance, beautiful in semblance, and glorified by many, he shines like a man with opulence.

translations.text: Agni, ministrant of the sacrifice, do you who are entitled to worship, be above usin this offering to the gods; for you prevail over all that is desirable; you inspire the praise of the worshipper.

text.sanskrit: अमूरो होता न्यसादि विक्ष्वग्निर्मंद्रो विदथेषु प्रचेताः ।ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सवितेवाश्रेन्मेतेव धूमं स्तभायदुप द्यां ॥

translations.text: The unperplexed, the sagacious, exhilaratingAgni, the ministrant priest, has been plural ced among men for (the celebration of) sacrifices; like the sun, he spreads light above, and props the smoke above the sky like a pillar.

text.sanskrit: यता सुजूर्णी रातिनी घृताची प्रदक्षिणिद्देवतातिमुराणः ।उदु स्वरुर्नवजा नाक्रः पश्वो अनक्ति सुधितः सुमेकः ॥
text.iast: yatā  su-jūrṇíḥ  rātínī  ghṛtācī  pra-dakṣiṇít  deva-tātim  urāṇaḥ ut  ūṃ íti  svaruḥ  nava-jāḥ  na  akraḥ  paśvaḥ  anakti  su-dhitaḥ  su-mekaḥ ||

translations.text: The ladle filled (with butter) is prepared; prompt (in act), opulent (with the oblation), the multiplying (priest), conducting (the worship) of the gods, circumambulates (the fire); the newly-trimmedpostis set up, the impending shining axe falls upon the victims.

text.sanskrit: स्तीर्णे बर्हिषि समिधाने अग्ना ऊर्ध्वो अध्वर्युर्जुजुषाणो अस्थात् ।पर्यग्निः पशुपा न होता त्रिविष्ट्येति प्रदिव उराणः ॥

text.sanskrit: परि त्मना मितद्रुरेति होताग्निर्मंद्रो मधुवचा ऋतावा ।द्रवंत्यस्य वाजिनो न शोका भयंते विश्वा भुवना यदभ्राट् ॥

translations.text: Agni, the sacrificer, the exhilarator, the sweet-spoken, the object of sacrifice, moving measuredly, circumambulates (the victim) of his own (accord); the bright (rays) of him (fed) with (sacrificial) food, spread around; all the regions are alarmed when he blazes.

translations.text: Agni, who are engendered repeatedly, and glorified by sacrifice, set open heaven to him who offers you adoration; resplendent (Agni), bestow upon us that ample and acceptable (wealth), which, radiant (deity), you with all the gods, have given (to other worshippers).

text.sanskrit: त्वदग्ने काव्या त्वन्मनीषास्त्वदुक्था जायंते राध्यानि ।त्वदेति द्रविणं वीरपेशा इत्थाधिये दाशुषे मर्त्याय ॥

translations.text: The offerings (to the gods) are engendered,Agni, of you; from you (proceed) praises; from you effective prayers; from you come a vigorous frame and wealth to man who worships with sincerity and offers oblations.

text.sanskrit: त्वद्वाजी वाजंभरो विहाया अभिष्टिकृज्जायते सत्यशुष्मः ।त्वद्रयिर्देवजूतो मयोभुस्त्वदाशुर्जूजुवाँ अग्ने अर्वा ॥

translations.text: From you, who are vigorous, to conveyer of oblations, the vast, the granter of what is desired, is born (a son) of real strength; from you comes wealth approved of by the gods, the source of happiness; from you,Agni, (is obtained) a swift unarrested horse.

text.sanskrit: त्वामग्ने प्रथमं देवयंतो देवं मर्ता अमृत मंद्रजिह्वं ।द्वेषोयुतमा विवासंति धीभिर्दमूनसं गृहपतिममूरं ॥

translations.text: ImmortalAgni, devout mortals worship with holy rites you the first deity (of the gods), whose tongue exhilarates (them), the dissipator of sin, the humiliator (of the demons) the lord of the mansion, the unperplexed.

text.sanskrit: आरे अस्मदमतिमारे अंह आरे विश्वां दुर्मतिं यन्निपासि ।दोषा शिवः सहसः सूनो अग्ने यं देव आ चित्सचसे स्वस्ति ॥

translations.text: Agni, son of strength, since you protect (your worshippers), far (remove) from us all iniquity; far (remove from us) sin; far (from us) all evil thoughts; for proeperous is he of whom you who are radiant by night promote the well-being.

text.sanskrit: यस्त्वामग्न इनधते यतस्रुक्त्रिस्ते अन्नं कृणवत्सस्मिन्नहन् ।स सु द्युम्नैरभ्यस्तु प्रसक्षत्तव क्रत्वा जातवेदश्चिकित्वान् ॥

translations.text: May he who with uplifted ladle kindles you, and thrice every day presents to you the (sacrificial) food, knowing your glory,Jātavedas, to be invigorated by the act, surpass (all others) in riches.

translations.text: He who, labouring diligently, brings you fuel, honouring,Agni, your great glory; he who kindles you in the evening and at dawn; he, prosperous and destroying his enemies, acquires riches.

text.sanskrit: अग्निरीशे बृहतः क्षत्रियस्याग्निर्वाजस्य परमस्य रायः ।दधाति रत्नं विधते यविष्ठो व्यानुषङ्मर्त्याय स्वधावान् ॥

translations.text: Agniis the possessor of great strength of excellent food of riches, the young (of the gods); abounding in sustenance, he gives to the mortal who worships him precious (wealth) according to (his devotion).

translations.text: Let not us,Agni, who are your friends, ever suffer harm from any great or comprehensive offence against either gods or men; bestow forgiveness upon our sons and grandsons, the reward of what has been well done.

text.sanskrit: अनायतो अनिबद्धः कथायं न्यङ्ङुत्तानोऽव पद्यते न ।कया याति स्वधया को ददर्श दिवः स्कंभः समृतः पाति नाकं ॥

text.sanskrit: त्राता नो बोधि ददृशान आपिरभिख्याता मर्डिता सोम्यानां ।सखा पिता पितृतमः पितॄणां कर्तेमु लोकमुशते वयोधाः ॥
text.iast: trātā  naḥ  bodhi  dadṛśānaḥ  āpíḥ  abhi-khyātā  marḍitā  somyānām sakhā  pitā  pitṛ-tamaḥ  pitṝṇām  kartā  īm  ūṃ íti  lokam  uśate  vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||

translations.text: Be our preserver, you who are looking (benevolently upon) all; a kinsman (to us); a supervisor (of all things), a bestower of felicity on those who are worthy (to offer) libations; a friend, a protector, a defender in the highest degree among defenders, a creator; (be you, who bestows) the world of heaven upon him who desires it, the giver to us of food.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: सखीयतामविता बोधि सखा गृणान इंद्र स्तुवते वयो धाः ।वयं ह्या ते चकृमा सबाध आभिः शमीभिर्महयंत इंद्र ॥
text.iast: sakhi-yatām  avitā  bodhi  sakhā  gṛṇānaḥ  indra  stuvate  vayaḥ  dhāḥ vayam  hí  ā  te  cakṛma  sa-bādhaḥ  ābhíḥ  śamībhiḥ  mahayantaḥ  indra ||

translations.text: Regard yourself as a protector of those who desire your friendship; be a friend deserving of commendation; grant,Indra, food to him who praises (you); suffering difficulties, we make our suppications to you, worshipping you with these holy rites.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: स्तुत इंद्रो मघवा यद्ध वृत्रा भूरीण्येको अप्रतीनि हंति ।अस्य प्रियो जरिता यस्य शर्मन्नकिर्देवा वारयंते न मर्ताः ॥
text.iast: stutaḥ  índraḥ  magha-vā  yat  ha  vṛtrā  bhūrīṇi  ekaḥ  apratīni  hanti asya  priyaḥ  jaritā  yasya  śarman  nakiḥ  devāḥ  vārayante  na  martāḥ ||

translations.text: WhenIndra, the possessor of opulence, is glorified, he singly destroys many unyielding foes; the worshipper is dear to him (who relies) on his protection, and neither gods nor men molest him.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: एवा न इंद्रो मघवा विरप्शी करत्सत्या चर्षणीधृदनर्वा ।त्वं राजा जनुषां धेह्यस्मे अधि श्रवो माहिनं यज्जरित्रे ॥
text.iast: eva  naḥ  índraḥ  magha-vā  vi-rapśī  karat  satyā  carṣaṇi-dhṛt  anarvā tvam  rājā  januṣām  dhehi  asme íti  adhi  śravaḥ  māhinam  yat  jaritre ||

translations.text: The many-voicedIndra, the possessor of opulence, the supporter of men, the irresistible bestows upon us, when praised by us, assured (rewards); you, (Indra), are the king of men; grant to us abundantly that great fame which (is due) to (your) worshipper.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: नू ष्टुत इंद्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः ।अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः ॥
text.iast: nu  stutaḥ  indra  nu  gṛṇānaḥ  íṣam  jaritre  nadyaḥ  na  pīperíti pīpeḥ akāri  te  hari-vaḥ  brahma  navyam  dhiyā  syāma  rathyaḥ  sadā-sāḥ ||

translations.text: Glorified (in the past), glorified,Indra, at present satisfy your worshipper with food, as rivers (are filled with water); lord of horses, a new hymn has been made for you; may we, possessed of chariots, be ever diligent in your praise.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अयं पंथा अनुवित्तः पुराणो यतो देवा उदजायंत विश्वे ।अतश्चिदा जनिषीष्ट प्रवृद्धो मा मातरममुया पत्तवे कः ॥
text.iast: ayam  panthāḥ  anu-vittaḥ  purāṇaḥ  yataḥ  devāḥ  ut-ajāyanta  víśve ataḥ  cit  ā  janiṣīṣṭa  pra-vṛddhaḥ  mā  mātaram  amuyā  pattave  karíti kaḥ ||

translations.text: Indraspeaks: This is the old and recognized path by which all the gods are born; so, when full-grown, let him be born in the same manner; let him not cause the loss of this his mother.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: नाहमतो निरया दुर्गहैतत्तिरश्चता पार्श्वान्निर्गमाणि ।बहूनि मे अकृता कर्त्वानि युध्यै त्वेन सं त्वेन पृच्छै ॥
text.iast: na  aham  ataḥ  níḥ  aya  duḥ-gahā  etat  tiraścatā  pārśvāt  níḥ  gamāni bahūni  me  akṛtā  kartvāni  yudhyai  tvena  sam  tvena  pṛcchai ||

translations.text: Vāmadevaspeaks: Let me not come forth by this path, for it is difficult (of issue); let me come forth obliquely from the side; many acts unperformed by others are to be accomplished by me; let me contend (in war) with one (enemy), in controversy with one opponent.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: परायतीं मातरमन्वचष्ट न नानु गान्यनु नू गमानि ।त्वष्टुर्गृहे अपिबत्सोममिंद्रः शतधन्यं चम्वोः सुतस्य ॥
text.iast: parā-yatīm  mātaram  anu  acaṣṭa  na  na  anu  gāni  anu  nu  gamāni tvaṣṭuḥ  gṛhe  apibat  somam  índraḥ  śata-dhanyam  camvoḥ  sutasya ||

translations.text: He, (Indra), has asserted (that it will) cause the death of my mother; let me not proceed by the usual way, but proceed quickly, according (to my will); in the dwelling ofTvaṣṭāIndra drank the costlySomafrom the vessels of the offerers.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: किं स ऋधक्कृणवद्यं सहस्रं मासो जभार शरदश्च पूर्वीः ।नही न्वस्य प्रतिमानमस्त्यंतर्जातेषूत ये जनित्वाः ॥
text.iast: kím  saḥ  ṛdhak  kṛṇavat  yam  sahasram  māsaḥ  jabhāra  śaradaḥ  ca  pūrvīḥ nahí  nu  asya  prati-mānam  asti  antaḥ  jāteṣu  uta  ye  jani-tvāḥ ||

translations.text: Aditispeaks: What irregular act has he committed whom (I, his mother), bore for a thousand months and for many years? there is no analogy between him and those who have been or will be born.

text.sanskrit: अवद्यमिव मन्यमाना गुहाकरिंद्रं माता वीर्येणा न्यृष्टं ।अथोदस्थात्स्वयमत्कं वसान आ रोदसी अपृणाज्जायमानः ॥
text.iast: avadyam-iva  manyamānā  guhā  akaḥ  índram  mātā  vīryeṇa  ní-ṛṣṭam atha  ut  asthāt  svayam  atkam  vasānaḥ  ā  rodasī íti  apṛṇāt  jāyamānaḥ ||

translations.text: Deeming it disreputable (that he should be brought forth) in secret, his mother endowed (Indra) with (extraordinary) vigour; therefore, as soon as born he sprung up of his own accord, invested with splendour, and filled both heaven and earth.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: एता अर्षंत्यललाभवंतीर्ऋतावरीरिव संक्रोशमानाः ।एता वि पृच्छ किमिदं भनंति कमापो अद्रिं परिधिं रुजंति ॥
text.iast: etāḥ  arṣanti  alalā-bhavantīḥ  ṛtavarīḥ-iva  sam-krośamānāḥ etāḥ  ví  pṛccha  kím  idam  bhananti  kam  āpaḥ  adrim  pari-dhím  rujanti ||

translations.text: These (rivers) flew murmuring as if, being filled with water, they were uttering sounds (of joy); ask them what is this they say; what is the encompassing cloud that the waters break through?

text.sanskrit: किमु ष्विदस्मै निविदो भनंतेंद्रस्यावद्यं दिधिषंत आपः ।ममैतान्पुत्रो महता वधेन वृत्रं जघन्वाँ असृजद्वि सिंधून् ॥
text.iast: kím  ūṃ íti  svit  asmai  ni-vídaḥ  bhananta  índrasya  avadyam  didhiṣante  āpaḥ mama  etān  putraḥ  mahatā  vadhena  vṛtram  jaghanvān  asṛjat  ví  síndhūn ||

translations.text: What do the sacred expiatory strains declare to me? the waters reeive the reproach ofIndra; my son has slainVṛtrawith the mighty thunderbolt; he has set those rivers free.

text.sanskrit: ममच्चन त्वा युवतिः परास ममच्चन त्वा कुषवा जगार ।ममच्चिदापः शिशवे ममृड्युर्ममच्चिदिंद्रः सहसोदतिष्ठत् ॥

translations.text: Vāmadevaspeaks: exulting one youthful mother brought you forth; exulting, Kuṣavā swallowed you; exulting, the waters gave delight to the infant;Indra, exulting, rose up by his strength.

translations.text: Vyaṃsa, exulting and striking (hard blows), smote you,Maghavan, upon the jaw; whereupon, being so smitten, you proved the stronger, and did crush the head of the slave with the thunderbolt.

text.sanskrit: गृष्टिः ससूव स्थविरं तवागामनाधृष्यं वृषभं तुम्रमिंद्रं ।अरीळ्हं वत्सं चरथाय माता स्वयं गातुं तन्व इच्छमानं ॥

translations.text: His mother inquired of the mightyIndra, have these deities deserted you, my son? then Indra andViṣṇu, my friend (if you) purpose slayingVṛtraexert your greatest prowess.

text.sanskrit: कस्ते मातरं विधवामचक्रच्छयुं कस्त्वामजिघांसच्चरंतं ।कस्ते देवो अधि मार्डीक आसीद्यत्प्राक्षिणाः पितरं पादगृह्य ॥

translations.text: Who has made your mother a widow? who has sought to slay the sleeping and the walking? what deity has been more gracious than you since you have slain the father, having seized him by the foot?

text.iast: avartyā  śunaḥ  āntrāṇi  pece  na  deveṣu  vivide  marḍitāram apaśyam  jāyām  amahīyamānām  adha  me  śyenaḥ  madhu  ā  jabhāra ||

translations.text: In extreme destitution I have cooked the entrails of a dog; I have not found a comforter among the gods; I have beheld my wife disrsepected; then the falcon, (Indra), has brought to me sweet water.

text.sanskrit: अक्षोदयच्छवसा क्षाम बुध्नं वार्ण वातस्तविषीभिरिंद्रः ।दृळ्हान्यौभ्नादुशमान ओजोऽवाभिनत्ककुभः पर्वतानां ॥

translations.text: Indra, by his strength, has agitated the exhausted firmament, as wind, by its violent (gusts, agitates) the water; exulting in his strength, he has divided the solid (clouds), and has shattered the peaks of the mountains.

translations.text: TheMarutshave hastened to you like mother to their young; like chariots they have rushed in along (with you); you,Indra, have satisfied the following streams; you have shattered the clouds; you have set free the obstructed rivers.

text.sanskrit: आ यात्विंद्रो दिव आ पृथिव्या मक्षू समुद्रादुत वा पुरीषात् ।स्वर्णरादवसे नो मरुत्वान्परावतो वा सदनादृतस्य ॥

translations.text: MayIndra, accompanied by theMarutscome quickly for our protection, from the heaven, from the earth, from the firmament, or from the waters; from the sphere of the sun, from (any) distant region, from the abode of the rains.

text.sanskrit: उप यो नमो नमसि स्तभायन्नियर्ति वाचं जनयन्यजध्यै ।ऋंजसानः पुरुवार उक्थैरेंद्रं कृण्वीत सदनेषु होता ॥

text.sanskrit: सत्रा यदीं भार्वरस्य वृष्णः सिषक्ति शुष्मः स्तुवते भराय ।गुहा यदीमौशिजस्य गोहे प्र यद्धिये प्रायसे मदाय ॥
text.iast: satrā  yat  īm  bhārvarasya  vṛṣṇaḥ  sísakti  śuṣmaḥ  stuvate  bharāya guhā  yat  īm  auśijasya  gohe  pra  yat  dhiye  pra  ayase  madāya ||

translations.text: True it is that this might of the son of the protector of the world, the showerer (of benefits), affects for his advantage the offerer of praise; it (prevails) in the secret (thoughts) of the worshipper, and in his dwelling, for (the accomplishment of his) pious acts, (the attainment of his) desires, and his delight.

text.sanskrit: वि यद्वरांसि पर्वतस्य वृण्वे पयोभिर्जिन्वे अपां जवांसि ।विदद्गौरस्य गवयस्य गोहे यदी वाजाय सुध्यो वहंति ॥

translations.text: Inasmuch as he has opened the doors of the cloud, and has supplied the rapid courses of the waters with (additional) torrents, so when the pious have recourse toIndrafor food, he finds (it) in the haunt of theGauraandGavaya.

text.sanskrit: भद्रा ते हस्ता सुकृतोत पाणी प्रयंतारा स्तुवते राध इंद्र ।का ते निषत्तिः किमु नो ममत्सि किं नोदुदु हर्षसे दातवा उ ॥
text.iast: bhadrā  te  hastā  su-kṛtā  uta  pāṇī íti  pra-yantārā  stuvate  rādhaḥ  indra kā  te  ní-sattiḥ  kím  ūṃ íti  naḥ  mamatsi  kím  na  ut-ut  ūṃ íti  harṣase  dātavai  ūṃ íti ||

translations.text: Your auspicioushands,Indra, are the doers of good deeds; your two hands, Indra, are the extenders of wealth to him who praises you; what, Indra, is this delay? why do you not exhilarate us? why are you not delighted to make us gifts?

text.sanskrit: एवा वस्व इंद्रः सत्यः सम्राड्ढंता वृत्रं वरिवः पूरवे कः ।पुरुष्टुत क्रत्वा नः शग्धि रायो भक्षीय तेऽवसो दैव्यस्य ॥

translations.text: Thus (glorified),Indra, who is faithful (to his word), the lord of wealth, the slayer ofVṛtra, bestows rihes on man; so you, the praised of many, give us riches for our pious acts, that I may eat of your divine food.

text.sanskrit: को अस्य वीरः सधमादमाप समानंश सुमतिभिः को अस्य ।कदस्य चित्रं चिकिते कदूती वृधे भुवच्छशमानस्य यज्योः ॥
text.iast: kaḥ  asya  vīraḥ  sadha-mādam  āpa  sam  ānaṃśa  sumatí-bhiḥ  kaḥ  asya kat  asya  citram  cikite  kat  ūtī  vṛdhe  bhuvat  śaśamānasya  yajyoḥ ||

translations.text: What hero has enjoyed his fellowship (in battle)? who has been a sharer in his benevolent thoughts? when does any one appreciate his wonderful bounty? when is he (presen) for the promotion of the prosperity of the man who glorifies and worships him?
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: कथा शृणोति हूयमानमिंद्रः कथा शृण्वन्नवसामस्य वेद ।का अस्य पूर्वीरुपमातयो ह कथैनमाहुः पपुरिं जरित्रे ॥
text.iast: kathā  śṛṇoti  hūyamānam  índraḥ  kathā  śṛṇvan  avasām  asya  veda kāḥ  asya  pūrvīḥ  upa-mātayaḥ  ha  kathā  enam  āhuḥ  papurim  jaritre ||

translations.text: How is thatIndrahears (the worshipper) who invokes him? and, hearing, how does he know his necessities? what are his gifts of old; why have they termed him the fulfiller (of the desires) of him who offers praise?
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: कथा सबाधः शशमानो अस्य नशदभि द्रविणं दीध्यानः ।देवो भुवन्नवेदा म ऋतानां नमो जगृभ्वाँ अभि यज्जुजोषत् ॥
text.iast: kathā  sa-bādhaḥ  śaśamānaḥ  asya  naśat  abhí  draviṇam  dīdhyānaḥ devaḥ  bhuvat  navedāḥ  me  ṛtānām  namaḥ  jagṛbhvān  abhí  yat  jujoṣat ||

translations.text: How does he who glorifiesIndra, and is diligent in his worship, although encountering opposition, obtain from him wealth? may the divine Indra be the appreciation of my praises, when accepting the sacrificial food he is propitiated towards me.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: कथा कदस्या उषसो व्युष्टौ देवो मर्तस्य सख्यं जुजोष ।कथा कदस्य सख्यं सखिभ्यो ये अस्मिन्कामं सुयुजं ततस्रे ॥
text.iast: kathā  kat  asyāḥ  uṣasaḥ  ví-uṣṭau  devaḥ  martasya  sakhyam  jujoṣa kathā  kat  asya  sakhyam  sakhi-bhyaḥ  ye  asmin  kāmam  su-yujam  tatasre ||

translations.text: When, in what manner, at the dawning of this morning, has the divineIndraaccepted the friendship of a mortal? when and in what manner, (is) his friendship (manifested) to the friends who have spread out the desirable and suitable (offering) before him?
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: किमादमत्रं सख्यं सखिभ्यः कदा नु ते भ्रात्रं प्र ब्रवाम ।श्रिये सुदृशो वपुरस्य सर्गाः स्वर्ण चित्रतममिष आ गोः ॥
text.iast: kím  āt  amatram  sakhyam  sakhi-bhyaḥ  kadā  nu  te  bhrātram  pra  bravāma śriye  su-dṛśaḥ  vapuḥ  asya  sargāḥ  svaḥ  na  citra-tamam  iṣe  ā  goḥ ||

translations.text: May we in any manner proclaim your friendship for your friends? when may (we make known) your fraternal regard? the efforts of the well-lookingIndraare for the happiness of all; the wonderful form of the moving (Indra) is, like the sun, ever wished for.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: द्रुहं जिघांसंध्वरसमनिंद्रां तेतिक्ते तिग्मा तुजसे अनीका ।ऋणा चिद्यत्र ऋणया न उग्रो दूरे अज्ञाता उषसो बबाधे ॥
text.iast: druham  jíghāṃsan  dhvarasam  anindrām  tetikte  tigmā  tujase  anīkā ṛṇā  cit  yatra  ṛṇa-yāḥ  naḥ  ugraḥ  dūre  ajñātāḥ  uṣasaḥ  babādhe ||

translations.text: Resolving to kil the oppressing, malevolent (rākṣasi), not acknowledgingIndra, he sharpened his sharp weapons for (her) destruction, and the fierce (Indra) the canceller of debts, has kept afar the unknown dawns in which the debts (are to be paid).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: ऋतस्य हि शुरुधः संति पूर्वीर्ऋतस्य धीतिर्वृजिनानि हंति ।ऋतस्य श्लोको बधिरा ततर्द कर्णा बुधानः शुचमान आयोः ॥
text.iast: ṛtasya  hí  śurudhaḥ  santi  pūrvīḥ  ṛtasya  dhītíḥ  vṛjināni  hanti ṛtasya  ślokaḥ  badhirā  tatarda  karṇā  budhānaḥ  śucamānaḥ  āyoḥ ||

translations.text: Many are the waters of ṛta; the adoration of ṛta destroys iniquities; the intelligent and brilliant praise of ṛta has opened the deaf (ears) of man.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: ऋतस्य दृळ्हा धरुणानि संति पुरूणि चंद्रा वपुषे वपूंषि ।ऋतेन दीर्घमिषणंत पृक्ष ऋतेन गाव ऋतमा विवेशुः ॥
text.iast: ṛtasya  dṛḷhā  dharuṇāni  santi  purūṇi  candrā  vapuṣe  vapūṃṣi ṛtena  dīrgham  iṣaṇanta  pṛkṣaḥ  ṛtena  gāvaḥ  ṛtam  ā  viveśuḥ ||

translations.text: Many are the stable, sustaining, delightful forms of the embodied ṛta; the ṛta are (the pious) expectant of food; by ṛta have the kine entered into the sacrifice.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: ऋतं येमान ऋतमिद्वनोत्यृतस्य शुष्मस्तुरया उ गव्युः ।ऋताय पृथ्वी बहुले गभीरे ऋताय धेनू परमे दुहाते ॥
text.iast: ṛtam  yemānaḥ  ṛtam  ít  vanoti  ṛtasya  śuṣmaḥ  tura-yāḥ  ūṃ íti  gavyuḥ ṛtāya  pṛthvī íti  bahule íti  gabhīre íti  ṛtāya  dhenū íti  parame íti  duhāte íti ||

translations.text: The (worshipper) subjecting ṛta (to his will) verily enjoys ṛta; the strength ṛta is (developed) with speed, and is desirous of (possessing) water; to ṛta belong the wide and profound heaven and earth; supreme kine, they yield their milk to ṛta.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: नू ष्टुत इंद्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः ।अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः ॥
text.iast: nu  stutaḥ  indra  nu  gṛṇānaḥ  íṣam  jaritre  nadyaḥ  na  pīperíti pīpeḥ akāri  te  hari-vaḥ  brahma  navyam  dhiyā  syāma  rathyaḥ  sadā-sāḥ ||

translations.text: Glorified (in the past), glorified,Indra, at present, satisfy your worshipper with food, as rivers (are filled with water); lord of horses, a new hymn has been made for you; may we possessed of chariots, be ever diligent in our praise.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: का सुष्टुतिः शवसः सूनुमिंद्रमर्वाचीनं राधस आ ववर्तत् ।ददिर्हि वीरो गृणते वसूनि स गोपतिर्निष्षिधां नो जनासः ॥
text.iast: kā  su-stutíḥ  śavasaḥ  sūnum  índram  arvācīnam  rādhase  ā  vavartat dadíḥ  hí  vīraḥ  gṛṇate  vasūni  saḥ  go-patiḥ  niḥ-sídhām  naḥ  janāsaḥ ||

translations.text: What suitable praise may bring the son of strength,Indra, before us, to give us wealth; the hero, the lord of cattle, is the donor, oḥ man, of the wealth of his adversaries to him who glorifies him.

text.sanskrit: स वृत्रहत्ये हव्यः स ईड्यः स सुष्टुत इंद्रः सत्यराधाः ।स यामन्ना मघवा मर्त्याय ब्रह्मण्यते सुष्वये वरिवो धात् ॥
text.iast: saḥ  vṛtra-hatye  havyaḥ  saḥ  īḍyaḥ  saḥ  su-stutaḥ  índraḥ  satya-rādhāḥ saḥ  yāman  ā  magha-vā  martyāya  brahmaṇyate  susvaye  varivaḥ  dhāt ||

translations.text: He,Indra, is to be invoked for the destruction ofVṛtra; he, the deservedly praised, is to be worshipped; the real donor of wealth, he,Maghavan, gives wealth, (acquired) in battle, to the mortal offers him prayer and libations.

text.sanskrit: तमिन्नरो वि ह्वयंते समीके रिरिक्वांसस्तन्वः कृण्वत त्रां ।मिथो यत्त्यागमुभयासो अग्मन्नरस्तोकस्य तनयस्य सातौ ॥
text.iast: tam  ít  naraḥ  ví  hvayante  sam-īke  ririkvāṃsaḥ  tanvaḥ  kṛṇvata  trām mithaḥ  yat  tyāgam  ubhayāsaḥ  agman  naraḥ  tokasya  tanayasya  sātau ||

translations.text: Men verily call upon him in battle; the (devout) inflicters of austerity upon their person ns constitute him their preserver; when both (the worshipper and the priest) approach together the bountifulIndra, men (succeed) in (obtaining) the gift of sons and grandsons.

text.sanskrit: क्रतूयंति क्षितयो योग उग्राशुषाणासो मिथो अर्णसातौ ।सं यद्विशोऽववृत्रंत युध्मा आदिन्नेम इंद्रयंते अभीके ॥
text.iast: kratu-yanti  kṣitayaḥ  yoge  ugra  āśuṣāṇāsaḥ  mithaḥ  arṇa-sātau sam  yat  víśaḥ  avavṛtranta  yudhmāḥ  āt  ít  neme  indrayante  abhīke ||

translations.text: PowerfulIndra, men variously dispersed, come mutually together to celebrate sacred rites for the sake of obtaining rain; when men who are combatants assemble in battle, there are some of them who rely upon Indra.

text.sanskrit: आदिद्ध नेम इंद्रियं यजंत आदित्पक्तिः पुरोळाशं रिरिच्यात् ।आदित्सोमो वि पपृच्यादसुष्वीनादिज्जुजोष वृषभं यजध्यै ॥
text.iast: āt  ít  ha  neme  indriyam  yajante  āt  ít  paktíḥ  puroḷāśam  riricyāt āt  ít  somaḥ  ví  papṛcyāt  asusvīn  āt  ít  jujoṣa  vṛṣabham  yajadhyai ||

translations.text: Thereupon some verily worship the powerful (Indra); thereupon one man prepares the buttered cake that he may offer it to (Indra); thereupon the offerer of theSomahe distinguishes from him who presents no libation; thereupon some one rejoices to worship the showerer (of benefits).

text.sanskrit: कृणोत्यस्मै वरिवो य इत्थेंद्राय सोममुशते सुनोति ।सध्रीचीनेन मनसाविवेनंतमित्सखायं कृणुते समत्सु ॥

translations.text: Indrabestows wealth upon him who offers a libation to him, desiring it, though in another sphere; and, with a humble mind, makes him who is devoted to him his friend in combats.

text.sanskrit: य इंद्राय सुनवत्सोममद्य पचात्पक्तीरुत भृज्जाति धानाः ।प्रति मनायोरुचथानि हर्यंतस्मिंदधद्वृषणं शुष्ममिंद्रः ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  índrāya  sunavat  somam  adya  pacāt  paktīḥ  uta  bhṛjjāti  dhānāḥ prati  manāyoḥ  ucathāni  haryan  tasmin  dadhat  vṛṣaṇam  śuṣmam  índraḥ ||

translations.text: Indraaccepting graciously the praises of his devoted (worshipper), who today pours out the libation to him who toasts the buttered cakes, or fries barley for Indra, exercises towards him the power that grants his desires.

text.sanskrit: यदा समर्यं व्यचेदृघावा दीर्घं यदाजिमभ्यख्यदर्यः ।अचिक्रदद्वृषणं पत्न्यच्छा दुरोण आ निशितं सोमसुद्भिः ॥

translations.text: When the destroyer (of enemies) distinguishes a mortal foe; when the lord is engaged in the long (continued) battle, (his) bride summons to the dwelling the showerer (of benefits), encompassed by the offerers of the libation.

text.sanskrit: भूयसा वस्नमचरत्कनीयोऽविक्रीतो अकानिषं पुनर्यन् ।स भूयसा कनीयो नारिरेचीद्दीना दक्षा वि दुहंति प्र वाणं ॥
text.iast: bhūyasā  vasnam  acarat  kanīyaḥ  avi-krītaḥ  akāniṣam  punaḥ  yan saḥ  bhūyasā  kanīyaḥ  na  arirecīt  dīnāḥ  dakṣāḥ  ví  duhanti  pra  vāṇam ||

translations.text: A man has realized a small price for an article of great value, and again coming (to the buyer he says) this has not been sold; I require the full price; but he does not recover a small price by a large (equivalent); whether helpless or clever they adhere to their bargain.

text.sanskrit: को अद्य नर्यो देवकाम उशन्निंद्रस्य सख्यं जुजोष ।को वा महेऽवसे पार्याय समिद्धे अग्नौ सुतसोम ईट्टे ॥

translations.text: What friend of man, or worshipper of the gods, deserving the friendship ofIndra, has today enjoyed (it)? or what offerer of the libation on the kindled fire praises him (sufficiently) for his great and unbounded protection?
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: को नानाम वचसा सोम्याय मनायुर्वा भवति वस्त उस्राः ।क इंद्रस्य युज्यं कः सखित्वं को भ्रात्रं वष्टि कवये क ऊती ॥

translations.text: Who has reverenced with (suitable) words the (deity) worthy of the libation? who is devoted (to him)? who supports the cattle (given by him)? who desires the society ofIndra? who his friendship? who his fraternity? who (has recourse) to the sage Indra for protection?

text.sanskrit: तस्मा अग्निर्भारतः शर्म यंसज्ज्योक्पश्यात्सूर्यमुच्चरंतं ।य इंद्राय सुनवामेत्याह नरे नर्याय नृतमाय नृणां ॥

translations.text: MayAgni, the bearer of oblations, grant him felicity, and long behold the rising sun (in the dwelling of him) who says, let us offer libations toIndra, leader (of rites) the friend of man, the chief leader among leaders.

translations.text: Him neither many nor few can molest; mayAditigrant him infinite happiness; the performer of pious acts is dear (toIndra); dear to Indra is he whose mind is intent upon him; dear is he who approaches him with homage; dear to him is the offerer of the libation.

text.sanskrit: सुप्राव्यः प्राशुषाळेष वीरः सुष्वेः पक्तिं कृणुते केवलेंद्रः ।नासुष्वेरापिर्न सखा न जामिर्दुष्प्राव्योऽवहंतेदवाचः ॥

translations.text: This hero,Indra, the prompt discomfiter (of foes), who is to be approached with homage, grants special maturity to the presenter of the libation; he is not the kinsman, nor friend, nor relative, of him who offers no libation (to him); he is difficult of access, and the punisher of him who repeats not (his) praise.

translations.text: (Indra), the drinker of the effusedSoma, contract no friendship with the wealthy trader who offers not any libation; he takes away his wealth; destroys him when destitute; but he is a special (friend) to him who presents the libation and oblation.

translations.text: The most exalted, the most humble, (invoke)Indra; the middle (classes) invoke Indra; those going, those stopping, (invoke) Indra; those dwelling at home, those going in battle, (invoke) Indra; men needing food invoke Indra.

translations.text: I have beenManuandSūrya; I am the wise ṛṣi:Kakṣīvat; I have befriendedKutsa, the son ofArjuni; I am the far-seeingUśanās; so behold me.

translations.text: When the bird, intimidating (its guardians), carried off from hence (theSoma) it was at large; (flying) swift as thought along the vast path (of the firmament), it went rapidly with the sweet Soma, and the hawks thence acquired the celebrity in this world.

text.sanskrit: गर्भे नु सन्नन्वेषामवेदमहं देवानां जनिमानि विश्वा ।शतं मा पुर आयसीररक्षन्नध श्येनो जवसा निरदीयं ॥

text.sanskrit: न घा स मामप जोषं जभाराभीमास त्वक्षसा वीर्येण ।ईर्मा पुरंधिरजहादरातीरुत वाताँ अतरच्छूशुवानः ॥

translations.text: That embryo did not beguile me into satisfaction, but by the keen energy (of divine wisdom), I triumphed over it; the impeller of all, the sustainer of many, abandoned the foes (of knowledge), and, expanding, passed beyond the winds (of worldly troubles).

text.sanskrit: अयं वो यज्ञ ऋभवोऽकारि यमा मनुष्वत्प्रदिवो दधिध्वे ।प्र वोऽच्छा जुजुषाणासो अस्थुरभूत विश्वे अग्रियोत वाजाः ॥

translations.text: This sacrifice,Ṛbhus, has been instrumental tuted for you, who are eminently resplendent, which you have accepted after the manner of men; before you have the propitiatory (libations) been plural ced, forVājas, you are all entitled to precedence.

text.sanskrit: अभूदु वो विधते रत्नधेयमिदा नरो दाशुषे मर्त्याय ।पिबत वाजा ऋभवो ददे वो महि तृतीयं सवनं मदाय ॥

translations.text: Now, leaders (of rites), the treasure that ought to be presented is to be given to the mortqal performing (the sacred rite), the offerer (of the libation); drink,Vājas(drink),Ṛbhus; I present it to you at the third solemn (diurnal) ceremony for your exhilaration.

text.sanskrit: आ वाजा यातोप न ऋभुक्षा महो नरो द्रविणसो गृणानाः ।आ वः पीतयोऽभिपित्वे अह्नामिमा अस्तं नवस्व इव ग्मन् ॥

translations.text: Vājas, Ṛbhukṣans, leaders (of rites), come to us eulogizing exceeding wealth; these draughts (ofSoma) proceed to you at the decline of day, like newly-delivered cows to their stalls.

text.sanskrit: आ नपातः शवसो यातनोपेमं यज्ञं नमसा हूयमानाः ।सजोषसः सूरयो यस्य च स्थ मध्वः पात रत्नधा इंद्रवंतः ॥

translations.text: Sons of strength, come to this sacrifice, invoked with veneration; givers of precious things, associated withIndra, with whom you are intelligent, participate in being gratified (by the libation), drink ofthe sweetSomajuice.

text.sanskrit: सजोषा इंद्र वरुणेन सोमं सजोषाः पाहि गिर्वणो मरुद्भिः ।अग्रेपाभिर्ऋतुपाभिः सजोषा ग्नास्पत्नीभी रत्नधाभिः सजोषाः ॥
text.iast: sa-joṣāḥ  indra  varuṇena  somam  sa-joṣāḥ  pāhi  girvaṇaḥ  marut-bhiḥ agre-pābhiḥ  ṛtu-pābhiḥ  sa-joṣāḥ  gnāḥpatnībhiḥ  ratna-dhābhiḥ  sa-joṣāḥ ||

translations.text: Sympathizing in satisfaction withVaruṇa, drink,Indra, theSomajuice; drink it, you who are entitled to praise, sympathizing with theMaruts; drink, sympathizing with the first drinkers, with the drinkers (at the sacriices) of the Ṛtus; sympathizing with the protectresses of the wives (of the gods), the giver of wealth.

text.sanskrit: ये अश्विना ये पितरा य ऊती धेनुं ततक्षुर्ऋभवो ये अश्वा ।ये अंसत्रा य ऋधग्रोदसी ये विभ्वो नरः स्वपत्यानि चक्रुः ॥

translations.text: You have made the single ladle fourfold; by your (marvellous) acts you have clothed the cow with a (new) hide; therefore you have obtained immortality among the gods; such acts,VājasandṚbhus, are to be eagerly glorified.

text.sanskrit: ऋभुतो रयिः प्रथमश्रवस्तमो वाजश्रुतासो यमजीजनन्नरः ।विभ्वतष्टो विदथेषु प्रवाच्यो यं देवासोऽवथा स विचर्षणिः ॥

translations.text: From theṚbhusmay wealth, the best and most productive of food, (come to me); that which the leaders of rites renowned together with theVājas, have engendered; that which has been fabricated by Vibhvan and is to be celebrated at sacrifice; that which, deities you protect, that is to be beheld.

text.sanskrit: स वाज्यर्वा स ऋषिर्वचस्यया स शूरो अस्ता पृतनासु दुष्टरः ।स रायस्पोषं स सुवीर्यं दधे यं वाजो विभ्वाँ ऋभवो यमाविषुः ॥

text.sanskrit: उप नो वाजा अध्वरमृभुक्षा देवा यात पथिभिर्देवयानैः ।यथा यज्ञं मनुषो विक्ष्वासु दधिध्वे रण्वाः सुदिनेष्वह्नां ॥

text.sanskrit: ते वो हृदे मनसे संतु यज्ञा जुष्टासो अद्य घृतनिर्णिजो गुः ।प्र वः सुतासो हरयंत पूर्णाः क्रत्वे दक्षाय हर्षयंत पीताः ॥
text.iast: te  vaḥ  hṛde  manase  santu  yajñāḥ  juṣṭāsaḥ  adya  ghṛta-nirnijaḥ  guḥ pra  vaḥ  sutāsaḥ  harayanta  pūrṇāḥ  kratve  dakṣāya  harṣayanta  pītāḥ ||

translations.text: May these sacrifices be (acceptable) to you in heart and mind; may today the sufficient (juices) mixed with butter to you; the full libations are prepared for you; may they, when drunk, animate you for glorious deeds.

text.sanskrit: उत स्मास्य तन्यतोरिव द्योर्ऋघायतो अभियुजो भयंते ।यदा सहस्रमभि षीमयोधीद्दुर्वर्तुः स्मा भवति भीम ऋंजन् ॥
text.iast: uta  sma  asya  tanyatoḥ-iva  dyoḥ  ṛghāyataḥ  abhi-yujaḥ  bhayante yadā  sahasram  abhí  sīm  ayodhīt  duḥ-vartuḥ  sma  bhavati  bhīmaḥ  ṛñjan ||

translations.text: And the adversaries of that foe-destroying steed, like (those) of the brilliant thunderbolt, are alarmed; for when he contends, even against thousands on every side, then, rousing (his spirit), he is fearful and irresistible.

text.sanskrit: उत स्मास्य पनयंति जना जूतिं कृष्टिप्रो अभिभूतिमाशोः ।उतैनमाहुः समिथे वियंतः परा दधिक्रा असरत्सहस्रैः ॥

translations.text: Men praise the overpowering rapidty of that fleet (steed), who is the accomplisher (of the desires) of mankind, and following him to battle, they have said, Dadhikrā with (his) thousands has gone forth against the foe.

text.sanskrit: आ दधिक्राः शवसा पंच कृष्टीः सूर्य इव ज्योतिषापस्ततान ।सहस्रसाः शतसा वाज्यर्वा पृणक्तु मध्वा समिमा वचांसि ॥
text.iast: ā  dadhi-krāḥ  śavasā  pañca  kṛṣṭīḥ  sūryaḥ-iva  jyotiṣā  apaḥ  tatāna sahasra-sāḥ  śata-sāḥ  vājī  arvā  pṛṇaktu  madhvā  sam  imā  vacāṃsi ||

translations.text: Dadhikrā has spread abroad the five classes of beings by his strength, as the sun (diffuses) the waters by his radiance; may he, the giver of hundreds and thousands, associate these praises with agreeable (rewards).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: आशुं दधिक्रां तमु नु ष्टवाम दिवस्पृथिव्या उत चर्किराम ।उच्छंतीर्मामुषसः सूदयंत्वति विश्वानि दुरितानि पर्षन् ॥
text.iast: āśum  dadhi-krām  tam  ūṃ íti  nu  stavāma  divaḥ  pṛthivyāḥ  uta  carkirāma ucchantīḥ  mām  uṣasaḥ  sūdayantu  ati  víśvāni  duḥ-itāni  parṣan ||

translations.text: Verily we praise that swift Dadhikrā and scatter (proved before him) from heaven and earth; may the gloom-dispelling dawns preserve for me (all good things), and bear me beyond all evils.

text.sanskrit: महश्चर्कर्म्यर्वतः क्रतुप्रा दधिक्राव्णः पुरुवारस्य वृष्णः ।यं पूरुभ्यो दीदिवांसं नाग्निं ददथुर्मित्रावरुणा ततुरिं ॥

text.sanskrit: यो अश्वस्य दधिक्राव्णो अकारीत्समिद्धे अग्ना उषसो व्युष्टौ ।अनागसं तमदितिः कृणोतु स मित्रेण वरुणेना सजोषाः ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  aśvasya  dadhi-krāvṇaḥ  akārīt  sam-iddhe  agnau  uṣasaḥ  ví-uṣṭau anāgasam  tam  aditiḥ  kṛṇotu  saḥ  mitreṇa  varuṇena  sa-joṣāḥ ||

translations.text: MayAditi, consentient withMitraandVaruṇarender him free from sin who has performed the worship of the steed Dadhikrā, when the fire has been kindled at the opening of the dawn.

text.sanskrit: दधिक्राव्ण इष ऊर्जो महो यदमन्महि मरुतां नाम भद्रं ।स्वस्तये वरुणं मित्रमग्निं हवामह इंद्रं वज्रबाहुं ॥

translations.text: While we glorify the name of the great Dadhikrā the means of sustenance and of strength, the prosperity of those who praise (him), let us invoke (also) for our welfareVaruṇa,Mitra,Agni, andIndra, the bearer of the thunderbolt.

text.iast: satvā  bhariṣaḥ  go-iṣaḥ  duvanya-sat  śravasyāt  iṣaḥ  uṣasaḥ  turaṇya-sat satyaḥ  dravaḥ  dravaraḥ  pataṅgaraḥ  dadhi-krāvā  íṣam  ūrjam  svaḥ  janat ||

translations.text: He is theHaṃsa, (the sun), dwelling;Vasu(the wind), dwelling in the firmament; the invoker of the gods (Agni), dwelling on the altar; the guest (of the worshipper), dweling in the house (as the culinary fire); the dweller among men, (as consciousness), the dweller in the most excellent (orbl, the sun), the dweller in truth, the dweller in the sky (the air), born in the waters, in the rays of light, in the verity (of manifestation) in the (eastern) mountain, the truth (itself).

text.sanskrit: इंद्रा को वां वरुणा सुम्नमाप स्तोमो हविष्माँ अमृतो न होता ।यो वां हृदि क्रतुमाँ अस्मदुक्तः पस्पर्शदिंद्रावरुणा नमस्वान् ॥

text.sanskrit: या वां संति पुरुस्पृहो नियुतो दाशुषे नरा ।अस्मे ता यज्ञवाहसेंद्रवायू नि यच्छतं ॥

translations.text: Leaders (of rites), conveyers of sacrifices,IndraandVāyu, give to us for the offer (of the oblation), thoseNiyutswho are your (steeds), and are desired of many.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

translations.text: Drink,Vāyu, the oblations yet untested, like (a prince) the terrifier of foes; (bestow) upon the worshipper wealth; come with your brilliant car to drink theSomajuice.

translations.text: The many-limbed Dawns rise up in the east, like the pillars plural nted at sacrifices (round the altar); radiant and purifying, they are manifested, opening the gates of the obstructing gloom.

translations.text: The gloom-dispelling, affluent Dawns animate the pious worshippers to offer (sacrificial) treasure; may the churlish (traffickers) sleep on unawakened, in the unlovely depth of darkness.

text.sanskrit: कुवित्स देवीः सनयो नवो वा यामो बभूयादुषसो वो अद्य ।येना नवग्वे अंगिरे दशग्वे सप्तास्ये रेवती रेवदूष ॥

translations.text: Divine Dawns, may your chariot, whether old or new, be frequent at this day's (worship), wherewith, affluent Dawns, possessing riches, (you shine) upon the seven-mouthed (troop of the)Aṅgirasas, the observers of the nine or ten days' rite.

translations.text: Mighty (Heaven and Earth), you fulfil the desires of your friend; distributing food and giving sustenance you have sat down at the sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: क्षेत्रस्य पतिना वयं हितेनेव जयामसि ।गामश्वं पोषयित्न्वा स नो मृळातीदृशे ॥

translations.text: With the master of the field, our friend, we triumph; may he bestow upon us cattle, horses, nourishment, for by such (gifts) he makes us happy.

text.sanskrit: धामंते विश्वं भुवनमधि श्रितमंतः समुद्रे हृद्यंतरायुषि ।अपामनीके समिथे य आभृतस्तमश्याम मधुमंतं त ऊर्मिं ॥

translations.text: The whole world, (Agni), finds an asylum in your effulgence, whether it be in the ocean, in the heart (of man), in the life (of living beings), in the assemblage of the waters, or in warfare; may we attain the sweet-flavoured wave which is established in your (essence).
